com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.util

Class Dates

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.util.Dates

  • public final class Dates
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of various date and time related runtime functions.

    • Method Detail

      • DateAdd

        public static void DateAdd(java.util.Calendar date,
                           int intervalKind,
                           int interval)
        Adds a time interval to the given date. Adding milliseconds has a separated method because interval in ms is long, not int.
        Parameters:
        date - date to add to
        intervalKind - kind of interval
        interval - units to add
        See Also:
        DateAddInMillis()

      • DateAddInMillis

        public static void DateAddInMillis(java.util.Calendar date,
                                   long millis)
        Adds an interval of milliseconds to the given date. Unlike other time units, milliseconds are saved as long, not int.
        Parameters:
        date - date to add to
        millis - an interval to add
        See Also:
        Dates.DateAdd()

      • DateValue

        public static java.util.Calendar DateValue(java.lang.String value)
        Creates a date from the given string.

        Dates must be formatted as follows:
        MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss
        or
        MM/DD/YYYY
        or
        hh:mm
        where MM is the month (01-12), DD the day (01-31), YYYY the year (0000-9999), hh the hours (00-23), mm the minutes (00-59) and ss the seconds (00-59).

        Parameters:
        value - string to convert
        Returns:
        date

      • Day

        public static int Day(java.util.Calendar date)
        Returns the day of the month for the given date.
        Parameters:
        date - date to get day of
        Returns:
        day (range 1 - 31)

      • ConvertDuration

        public static long ConvertDuration(long duration,
                                   int intervalKind)
        Returns the give duration in a specified time unit. Months and Years cannot be supported due to their inconsistency.
        Parameters:
        duration - duration to convert time unit
        intervalkind - time unit
        Returns:
        duration converted into a different time unit

      • FormatDateTime

        public static java.lang.String FormatDateTime(java.util.Calendar date,
                                              java.lang.String pattern)
        Converts and formats an instant into a string of date and time with the specified pattern.
        Parameters:
        date - date to format
        pattern - format of the date and time e.g. MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm:ss a, MMM d, yyyy HH:mm
        Returns:
        formatted date
        See Also:
        SimpleDateFormat

      • FormatDate

        public static java.lang.String FormatDate(java.util.Calendar date,
                                          java.lang.String pattern)
        Converts and formats an instant into a string of date with the specified pattern.
        Parameters:
        date - date to format
        pattern - format of the date e.g. MM/DD/YYYY or MMM d, yyyy
        Returns:
        formatted date
        See Also:
        SimpleDateFormat

        Returns:
        formatted date
        See Also:

                                             int month,
                                             int day)

        Parameters:

        month - month of the date
        day - day of the date
        Returns:
        Calendar (instant in time)
